Author: Carl Sagan
Quotte:
We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science.
and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Quotte: Everything is theoretically impossible until it is done."

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quotte:
The saddest aspect of life right now 
is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quotte: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it

Author: Hippocrates
Quotte:
There are in fact two things, science and opinion; 
the former begets knowledge, the latter ignorance.

Author: Thomas Edison
Quotte:
Until man duplicates a blade of grass, 
nature can laugh at his so-called scientific knowledge.

Author: Galileo Galilei
Quotte:
In questions of science, 
the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.

Author: Erwin Schrdinger
Quotte:
The scientist only imposes two things, namely truth and sincerity, 
imposes them upon himself and upon other scientists.

Author: Nikola Tesla
Quotte:
The day science begins to study non-physical phenomena, 
it will make more progress in one decade than in all the previous centuries of its existence.
